alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 08 at 2:42PM MST until May 08 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR ALL OF NORTHERN ARIZONA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM MST MONDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN ARIZONA... The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a Red Flag Warning due to strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM to 8 PM MST Monday. * AFFECTED AREA...All of northern Arizona today and much of northern Arizona on Monday. This includes portions of the Apache- Sitgreaves National Forest, Coconino National Forest, Kaibab National Forest and Tonto National Forest. * WINDS...Today, southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. Local gusts up to 60 mph downwind of high terrain features like the Kaibab Plateau. On Monday, southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring or are imminent. A combination of strong winds and low relative humidities can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid outdoor activities that can cause a spark near dry vegetation, such as yard work, target shooting, or campfires. Follow local fire restrictions. Check weather.gov/flagstaff for updates and livingwithfire.info for preparedness tips. Please notify field crews of this Red Flag Warning.
